resources.description: The SDMX Test Compability Kit (SDMX TCK) is a tool for measuring the compliance and coverage of an SDMX RESTful endpoint against the available SDMX REST API versions.
resources.supported_features: This is an extended text to add more information about the resource.

resources.description: sdmx.io is not a single project but an ecosystem of open source tools, patterns, guidance, learning materials and other resources like pre-configured containerised environments that make the software quick and simple to deploy. Sdmx.io, a valuable resource for tool developers as well as adopters.
resources.supported_features: This is an extended text to add more information about the resource.

tools.name: pysdmx
tools.description: pysdmx is a pragmatic and opinionated library written in Python. It focuses on simplicity, providing a subset of SDMX functionalities without requiring advanced knowledge of SDMX
tools.supported_features:
• Simplified subset of the SDMX information model in Python
  • Retrieve metadata from an SDMX registry to drive statistical processes
  • Data discovery and data retieval

tools.name: Fusion Metadata Registry (FMR)
tools.description: Fusion Metadata Registry (FMR) is a free to use SDMX structural metadata registry, data modelling platform and data processing engine for official statistics producers, collectors and reporters
tools.supported_features:
• A controlled repository for SDMX structural metadata, which acts as a single source of truth for: automated metadata-driven data processing systems, metadata needed by data providers in data collections, structures for the purposes of standardisation, statistical data harmonisation, and communal benefit
  • Three integrated metadata-driven data processing services: data validation, data transformation (mapping data between structures) and conversion of data between SDMX data formats.
  • Metadata authoring and maintenance web UI, enabling metadata managers to browse, author and maintain their structural metadata model.

tools.name: FMR Workbench
tools.description: The FMR Workbench is a remote registry browser and metadata maintenance tool which brings the strengths and capabilities of the FMR User Interface to any SDMX compliant registry, implementing an SDMX RESTful API
tools.supported_features: The FMR Workbench is a remote registry browser and metadata maintenance tool which brings the strengths and capabilities of the FMR User Interface to any SDMX compliant registry, implementing an SDMX RESTful API. One significant use case for FMR Workbench users is the ability to connect to .Stat-Suite spaces for browsing and maintaining .Stat-Suite structural metadata

tools.name: Fusion Transformer
tools.description: Fusion Transformer is a Java command line application that can be run on both Windows and Unix for transforming SDMX data and structure files supporting EDI, XML, JSON and CSV
tools.supported_features:
• SDMX structure messages: SDMX 2.0, 2.1, 3.0, XML and JSON
  • SDMX data messages: SDMX 2.1, 3.0, EDI, XML, JSON, CSV

tools.name: SDMX Dashboard Generator
tools.description: The SDMX Dashboard Generator (SDMX DG), co-winner of the SDMX Global Conference 2023 Hackathon, is an open source application that generates dynamic dashboards.
tools.supported_features:
• Most common visualization types such as key performance indicators (KPIs), lines, pie and bar charts
  • Dynamic integration of metadata available in multiple languages
  • Modularity and customizability of the dashboard layout and design set easily by the user via a specification file
  • Asynchronous retrieval of data and metadata from SDMX Rest API to ensure better performance
  • Running both on a local machine or on a server

tools.name: Gingado
tools.description: gingado is a machine learning library focused on economics and finance use cases. This package aims to be suitable for beginners and advanced users alike. Use cases may range from programmatic data retrievals using SDMX to experimentation with machine learning-based econometric estimators to more complex forecasting pipelines used in production.
tools.supported_features:
• Data augmentation, to add more data from official sources using SDMX, improving the machine models being trained by the user
  • Relevant datasets, both real and simulated, to allow for easier model development and comparison
  • Automatic benchmark model, to assess candidate models against a reasonably well-performant model
  • Machine learning-based estimators, to help answer questions of academic or practical importance
  • Support for model documentation, to embed documentation and ethical considerations in the model development phase
  • Utilities, including tools to allow for lagging variables in a straightforward way

tools.name: .Stat Suite
tools.description: The .Stat Suite is a standard-based, componentised, open-source platform for the efficient production and dissemination of high-quality statistical data. The product is based on the General Statistical Process Model (GSBPM) and the Statistical Data and Metadata eXchange standards.
tools.supported_features: This is an extended text to add more information about the tool, it could contain information about platforms etc.

tools.name: .Stat Data Explorer
tools.description: The .Stat Suite Data Explorer, a web-based application to easily find, access, and share data through a well-tuned navigation. Powered by the open-source platform .Stat Suite for the dissemination of Official Statistics.
tools.supported_features: This is an extended text to add more information about the tool, it could contain information about platforms etc.

tools.name: .Stat Data Lifecycle Manager
tools.description: The .Stat Data Lifecycle Manager, a set of adaptive back-office modules to efficiently and timely produce and (re-)use high quality statistical data by defining, running, automating, controlling and evaluating the underlying data processes.
tools.supported_features: This is an extended text to add more information about the tool, it could contain information about platforms etc.

tools.name: .Stat Core
tools.description: Fast and secure SDMX Data Store leveraging Eurostat’s (NSI Web Service implementation within its SDMX Reference Infrastructure.
tools.supported_features: Stores and retrieves statistical data & attribute values, localizable structural & referential metadata, data process information & user roles and permissions. Allows customising the authentication method with any identity provider based on the OpenID Connect standard. Implements a secure configuration approach. Allows managing separate physical versions of data as it goes through the statistical production life cycle (raw input data, processed data, data prepared for dissemination/reporting, disseminated/reported data, archived data, …) by using multiple instances of the Data Store facilitated with a specific data transfer service.

tools.name: .Stat DLM Excel Add-in
tools.description: .Stat DLM Excel Add-in is an Excel facilitator for data and referential metadata retrieval and editing. Directly within Excel it gives access to in-progress or published data, from internal or external SDMX data sources.
tools.supported_features: The DLM Excel Add-in is packaged as a ClickOnce application and is deployed using the common procedure for deployment of ClickOnce applications. The installation files are accessible from here along with more information about deployment, set up and configuration.

tools.name: SDMX Matrix Generator
tools.description: The SIS-CC SDMX Matrix Generator can be used to visually model and design SDMX data artefacts, and generate the SDMX-ML markup for implementation. It is an enhancement of the Generic SDMX Design Matrix which has proven to be successful as a collaborative design tool for non-SDMX experts.
tools.supported_features: The primary goal of the tool is to be able to create the artefacts without a lot of SDMX technical knowledge, and to put the focus on the statistical aspects of the data model.

tools.name: SDMX Power BI connector
tools.description: The SDMX Power BI connector makes it really simple for Power-BI report builders to quickly get data from an SDMX web service without having to bother about technical things like HTTP headers and parsing labels from codes. It can connect to any SDMX REST web service that supports the standard SDMX REST HTTP headers and can output SDMX-CSV (such as the NSI web service that is implemented by .Stat and many other platforms).
tools.supported_features: The SDMX Power BI Connector was officially certifed by Microsoft in March 2023.

tools.name: SDMX converter
tools.description: The SDMX Converter is a tool that converts statistical datasets between different formats (SDMX-ML, GESMES, Excel, DSPL)
tools.supported_features: This is an extended text to add more information about the tool, it could contain information about platforms etc.

tools.name: SDMX in EViews
tools.description:
SDMX in EViews is a web-application to download SDMX data into EViews. The app is built upon EViews ability to read HTML tables and works by translating HTML requests into SDMX requests and SDMX data into HTML table that can be easily downloaded by EViews.
    The app supports SDMX 2.1 requests for any providers. In addition, the app provides access to the lists of datasets, dimensions and codelists for Insee, ECB, Eurostat and Worldbank data.
    How to use the web-application along with examples is described on the homepage of the web-application: http://sdmx.herokuapp.com. To ease the use of the app, an Eviews subroutine can also be downloaded at http://sdmx.herokuapp.com/sub.html.
tools.owner: Banque de France (Macroeconomic Analysis and Forecasting Directorate)

tools.name: QuantHub SDMX SaaS Platform
tools.description: QuantHub is a Cloud platform, designed specifically to address the three pillars of digital transformation focused on democratizing access to internal and external data sources, data analysis and data dissemination across the enterprise and public space.  QuantHub is targeted to produce and manage macro and micro economic data products using SDMX 3.0 data model.
tools.supported_features: Data Ingestion Pipelines ; Data Modeling using SDMX 3.0 ; Data Transformation using Python ; Data Dissemination using SDMX API, Portal tools, Download; Integrations with Excel, Jupyter, PowerBI; Data and System Artifact’s Entitlement.
